H0.text: Which hormone helps control ovulation. Estrogen

H1.text: Which hormone helps control ovulation. Progesterone

H2.text: Which hormone helps control ovulation. Follicle-Stimulating Hormone (FSH)

H3.text: Which hormone helps control ovulation. Lh kit

A4.text: FSH stimulates the growth and recruitment of immature ovarian follicles in the ovary.

A5.text: The sharp increase in estradiol production by the dominant follicle (possibly along with a decrease in gonadotrophin surge-attenuating factor) cause a positive effect on the hypothalamus and pituitary and rapid GnRH pulses occur and an LH surge results.

A6.text: In females, an acute rise of LH known as an LH surge, triggers ovulation and development of the corpus luteum.

A7.text: Exceptionally high levels of estradiol induce hypothalamic production of progesterone, which stimulates elevated GnRH secretion, triggering a surge in LH.

A8.text: Luteinizing+Hormone at the U.S. National Library of Medicine Medical Subject Headings (MeSH)
